events.title: Alberta Invokes Notwithstanding Clause in Bill 2 to End Teachers Strike

details.description: The Alberta government passed Bill 2 (Back to School Act) using the notwithstanding clause to override Charter protections and legislate teachers back to work. The bill imposes a four-year contract on 51,000 striking teachers and restricts the ability to take future strike action.
impact: National constitutional debate over Section 33 usage
details.reversibility: Would require repeal/amendment by legislature or federal court challenge.

legalChallenges.description: Joint court challenge regarding freedom of association and Section 2(d)

sources.title: Alberta government uses notwithstanding clause to end teachers strike

events.title: Recall Act Amended: Threshold Lowered from 40% to 25%

impact: First recall petitions filed within weeks under new threshold

details.reversibility: Can be changed by simple majority in the legislature.
